meanings.definition: The number of lines of print in a newspaper or magazine article.
meanings.sent1: The linage of the article was quite high, making it stand out on the page.
meanings.sent2: The linage of the newspaper was carefully calculated to fit all the content.
meanings.sent3: The linage of the magazine article seemed to be in a race to cover the most space.
meanings.sent4: Her writing had a linage that flowed smoothly from start to finish.
meanings.sent5: The linage of the print created a visual rhythm that drew the reader in.

meanings.definition: The act of arranging in lines.
meanings.sent1: The linage of the text made it easy to read across the page.
meanings.sent2: His linage of the paragraphs helped organize the information clearly.
meanings.sent3: The linage of the books on the shelf looked like soldiers standing in formation.
meanings.sent4: She approached the linage of the chairs in the room like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The linage of the trees in the forest created a sense of order in the chaos.

meanings.definition: The total number of lines in a piece of writing.
meanings.sent1: The linage of the poem was short but impactful.
meanings.sent2: The linage of the play script determined its length and pacing.
meanings.sent3: The linage of the essay seemed to grow longer with each revision.
meanings.sent4: His linage of the story was concise yet full of depth.
meanings.sent5: The linage of the novel stretched across many pages, weaving a complex tale.
